author: TheSkiF4er
name: ProdStarterHub - Node TypeScript REST Service
shortDescription: Production-ready Node.js + TypeScript REST template (Express, Pino, Prometheus) with sensible defaults for config, logging, metrics and reproducible builds.

ProjectName.description: The generated project directory / artifact name.

NodeVersion.description: Target Node.js LTS major version for CI/docs.

PackageManager.description: Preferred package manager for the scaffold.

IncludeDocker.description: Include a multi-stage Dockerfile for reproducible builds.

IncludeCI.description: Include GitHub Actions workflows for build, lint, test and release.

manualInstructions.text: Run 'npm ci' or the equivalent for your chosen package manager (pnpm install / yarn install) to install dependencies.

args.args: -lc "if [ "${PackageManager}" = "pnpm" ]; then pnpm install || true; elif [ "${PackageManager}" = "yarn" ]; then yarn install --frozen-lockfile || true; else npm ci || true; fi"

postActions.description: Attempt a quick type-check/build to validate the scaffold (non-fatal).

manualInstructions.text: Run 'npm run type-check' or 'npm run build' to verify the project compiles successfully.

args.args: -lc "if [ -f package.json ]; then if [ "${PackageManager}" = "pnpm" ]; then pnpm -s run type-check || pnpm -s run build || true; elif [ "${PackageManager}" = "yarn" ]; then yarn type-check || yarn build || true; else npm run type-check || npm run build || true; fi; fi"

postActions.description: Initialize git repository and create initial commit

manualInstructions.text: Run 'git init && git add . && git commit -m "Initial scaffold from ProdStarterHub Node TypeScript template"'

args.args: -lc "git init && git add . && git commit -m 'Initial scaffold from ProdStarterHub Node TypeScript template' || true"

symbolsHelp.description: Customize generation: set ModuleName, ProjectName and choose PackageManager. After generation run the install command for your package manager and verify the build.
usageExamples:
# Example usage
cp -R node-service-typescript my-service && cd my-service
# set module name in package.json and run
npm ci
# type-check and build
npm run type-check && npm run build
